posts.post_content:
With [Leyline of Anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Anticipation), you could copy an [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn) this way. :)  
Step One: Get an Emrakul into a graveyard  
Step Two: Emrakul's final ability triggers.  
Step Three: Cast Body Double (it now has flash!)  
Step Four: Body Double resolves, then Emrakul's ability resolves.
posts.html:
With Leyline of Anticipation, you could copy an Emrakul, the Aeons Torn this way. :)

Step Two: Emrakul's final ability triggers.
Step Three: Cast Body Double (it now has flash!)
Step Four: Body Double resolves, then Emrakul's ability resolves.

Posted By: KarmasPayment (6/3/2010 11:34:34 PM)

posts.post_content:
so I kinda like [rise from the grave better](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rise from the grave better), because it's black.
  
though blue is my second favorite color, and this is a nice card and does do some cool combo's.
  
also in response to the question about phage, no you wouldn't lose, since the card comes into play as phage I think it counts as casting phage from your hand.
  
same is true of clone.
  
even [unstable shapeshifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=unstable shapeshifter) wouldn't kill you since phages you lose the game ability triggers when she enter's play (without being hardcast) and the shapeshifter is considered to already be in play (even if it changes come into play effects don't trigger, unlike this card)
posts.html:
so I kinda like rise from the grave better, because it's black.
though blue is my second favorite color, and this is a nice card and does do some cool combo's.
also in response to the question about phage, no you wouldn't lose, since the card comes into play as phage I think it counts as casting phage from your hand.

even unstable shapeshifter wouldn't kill you since phages you lose the game ability triggers when she enter's play (without being hardcast) and the shapeshifter is considered to already be in play (even if it changes come into play effects don't trigger, unlike this card)

posts.post_content:
Beter Combo with [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn ) .  
 Step One: Declare Attack phase  
Step Two: Turn sideways  
Step Three: ...profit   
  
if you want to take 2 extra turns [Time Stretch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stretch) is slightly more efficient and easier to pull off.
